titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: and I received the Communion at 8 a.m.

1560, and in neither did I observe the word "protestant". Is it therefore to be concluded that the Scottish Church is not Protestant? Yet no "argument" for the Catholic character of the C. of E. is more popular with our Ritualists than the fact that the word "Protestant" does not appear in the Prayer Book!

" military correspondent suggests that the Italian débâcle may be due to the infection of the troops with the revolutionary folly, which has already disarmed Russia. If this be the case, the gravity of the incident is greatly increased.
